intro: Dichorisandra aubletiana var. intermedia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a popular houseplant. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant flower colors, which range from white to purple.
